channel.title: I got 3 errors while compiling. Says I need a ;
channel.description:
I'm fairly new to coding java, and I've actually learned a lot since I started, 2 weeks back. But I was looking on a tutorial on how to make a funpk zone, the person did not explain what the codes meant, so I learned them myself. But when I attempted to compile I got this error. SAying I'm missing a ;. If I'm also missing something else, please point it out for me. Now I don't know where to put that ; so please no hate, as I'm fairly new to java.
Here is the link to the picture : http://i50.tinypic.com/a445g.png

item.title: I got 3 errors while compiling. Says I need a ;
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

ston3:

Thank you, the client.java code worked. But for “eyeownyew” it did not work.

Are you just making a void, giveLife, or are you just calling it?

Read full topic

item.title: I got 3 errors while compiling. Says I need a ;
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:442343”][quote author=ston3 link=topic=544977.msg3994994#msg3994994 date=1337136835]
playerassistant.java code

public void giveLife() && !c.inFunPk(); { c.isDead = false; c.faceUpdate(-1); c.freezeTimer = 0;
for playerassistant, i could have added the .infunpk code in the wrong place? Here is the new updated compiler errors:

[/quote]
What are you trying to do with that public void givelife?
Because what you have set up currently is way off.
Try this code for client.java:

if(inWild() && !inFunPk()) { safeTimer = 10; } if(safeTimer > 0 && !inWild()) { safeTimer--; }[/quote]
Holy shit, first comment where someone actually knew what they were talking about o.O

public void giveLife() { if(!c.inFunPk()) { c.isDead = false; c.faceUpdate(-1); c.freezeTimer = 0; } }

Read full topic

for playerassistant, i could have added the .infunpk code in the wrong place? Here is the new updated compiler errors:
http://i49.tinypic.com/29ffssi.png[/quote]
What are you trying to do with that public void givelife?
Because what you have set up currently is way off.
Try this code for client.java:

if(inWild() && !inFunPk()) { safeTimer = 10; } if(safeTimer > 0 && !inWild()) { safeTimer--; }

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

ston3:

That got me the same error I had before. Missing an ;. I now only have “illegal start of expression” error and “missing an ; on playerassistant.java”

First. Post the code in client.java you are trying to edit, in code brackets if you will.
Then go to line 1068 of PlayerAssistant.java and post that code in code brackets as well. We’ll work from there.
